meanings.definition: Not alphabetic; not using or relating to an alphabet.
meanings.sent1: The ancient symbols were analphabetic, unlike the letters we use today.
meanings.sent2: The tribal language was analphabetic, relying on pictorial representations.
meanings.sent3: The analphabetic markings on the cave wall puzzled the archaeologists.
meanings.sent4: In the digital age, handwritten letters seem almost analphabetic.
meanings.sent5: The artist's abstract painting appeared analphabetic to those unfamiliar with modern art.

meanings.definition: A person who is unable to read or write.
meanings.sent1: The kind librarian patiently helped the analphabetic man fill out the form.
meanings.sent2: The school provided special classes for analphabetic adults to learn literacy skills.
meanings.sent3: The analphabetic traveler relied on pictures and gestures to communicate.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the hero teaches the analphabetic prince how to read and write.
meanings.sent5: The community organized a program to assist analphabetic individuals in improving their literacy.
